body_text.text: Consider a closed subset of the plane delimited by a square. There are 10 equivalence classes: the set of points interior to the square, the set of points interior to its complement, the four vertices and the four open edges.
Now it can be shown that all strata at x can be defined by a common value r in expression (2).
Now we combine the notions of strata and of safe radius.
Singularity and nonsingularity do not go through restriction to affine subpaces.
Because of Lemma 2 we have

body_text.text: Consequently, via Lemmas 7 and 8 we get the following.
